definition: The distinctive manner of expression in writing, including word choice, sentence structure, and overall effect

positive_examples: Hemingway's style is characterized by short sentences and sparse description.
The academic style requires formal diction and hedged claims.
Shifting to a conversational style made the technical content more accessible.
Style encompasses both the what (content choices) and the how (formal choices).
negative_examples: The text has words and sentences.
training_hints.disambiguation: Distinctive manner of expression, not just quality or presence of writing
